intro: Pleurothallis chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant typically produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and yellow, often with a distinctive fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, organic-rich substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
